Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from eight fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus flower and rosette chain in added white outline with added red centres, above band of uncertain, smudged pattern between white lines; below, part of possible rosette with alternating red and white petals; exterior: broken maeander pattern between lines at rim; below, frieze of bulls to right (on left, foreparts of first bull; on right, tail and hind leg of second bull); elaborate rosette, dotted cross, rising and pendant roundels and pendant triangles as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a mediocre but big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice-kraters. Chalices in this group also display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1). The registration number 1924.12-1.412 given by Lemos is incorrect.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p.90-1, p. 121, p. 123, fig. 65, p. 255, no. 441, pl. 60)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1548) (phase 2)
